item.title: 美国 4 月就业增长小幅放缓；失业率稳定在 4.2
item.description: 美国 4 月份的就业增长略有放缓，但由于唐纳德-特朗普总统激进的关税政策加剧了经济的不确定性，劳动力市场的前景日益暗淡。【原文：U.S. job growth slowed marginally in April, but the outlook for the labor market is increasingly darkening as President Donald Trump's aggressive tariff policy heightens economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，与竞购英国石油公司相比，壳牌首席执行官更倾向于股票回购
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，壳牌公司首席执行官周五表示，他宁愿回购更多公司股票，也不愿发起对竞争对手石油巨头英国石油公司（BP）的收购要约。【原文：Shell CEO said on Friday he would rather buy back more of his company's own shares than launch a takeover bid for rival oil major BP, the Financial Times reported.】

item.title: 加拿大帝国石油公司因炼油利润率上升而实现季度利润增长
item.description: 周五，加拿大石油生产商帝国石油公司（Imperial Oil）公布第一季度利润增长，主要原因是其炼油和燃料销售业务的利润率上升，这使其在美国上市的股票在收盘前上涨了近 6%。【原文：Canadian oil producer Imperial Oil posted a rise in first-quarter profit on Friday, driven primarily by stronger margins in its refining and fuel sales business, sending its U.S.-listed shares up nearly 6% before the bell.】

item.title: 网络攻击后，英国 M&S 进入销售中断的第二周
item.description: 周五，英国马莎百货公司（Marks & Spencer）在遭受重大网络攻击后，第二周无法接受网上服装和家居订单，这影响了新一季产品的销售，因为英国正沐浴在创纪录的气温中。【原文：Britain's Marks & Spencer entered a second week unable to take online clothing and home orders on Friday following a major cyberattack, hitting sales of new season ranges as the country basks in record temperatures.】

item.title: Take-Two Interactive 将《侠盗猎车手 6》的发行时间推迟至 2026 年 5 月 26 日
item.description: Take-Two Interactive 周五将《侠盗猎车手 6》的发行时间推迟到了 2026 年 5 月 26 日，延长了人们对视频游戏史上最炙手可热的游戏之一的等待时间，导致其股价在盘前交易中暴跌 9%。【原文：Take-Two Interactive on Friday pushed the release of "Grand Theft Auto VI" to May 26, 2026, extending the wait for one of the most hotly anticipated titles in video-gaming history and sending its shares tumbling 9% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 早间竞标：五月买入？
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 环保组织抨击 JBS 获准在美国上市，华尔街却对此大加赞赏
item.description: 美国金融监管机构上个月批准了全球最大的肉类包装公司 JBS 在纽约证券交易所上市的提议，这招致了气候和动物权益组织的强烈批评，但却得到了华尔街的赞扬。【原文：The U.S. financial regulator's approval last month of a proposal by the world's largest meatpacker JBS to list on the New York Stock Exchange is drawing strong criticism from climate and animal rights groups but praise from Wall Street.】

item.title: 受欧盟碳排放规定和美国关税影响，大众汽车核心品牌集团利润下降
item.description: 大众汽车周五表示，受欧盟碳排放规定和与美国关税相关的库存减记的影响，其核心品牌集团（包括最畅销的大众品牌）的第一季度营业利润下降了 46.3%。【原文：Volkswagen on Friday said its first-quarter operating profit for the core brand group, which includes its best-selling VW brand, declined by 46.3%, impacted by EU carbon provisions and write-downs on inventory related to U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 利润低于预期，麦格纳计划采取成本削减措施以缓解关税冲击
item.description: 加拿大汽车零部件供应商麦格纳国际公司（Magna International）周五表示，该公司计划实施成本节约措施，以减轻美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）全面征收关税带来的冲击。【原文：Canadian auto parts supplier Magna International said on Friday that it plans to implement cost-saving measures to cushion the hit from U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势出现缓和迹象，期货上涨，就业数据受关注
item.description: 美国股指期货周五上涨，原因是中美贸易战有望缓和，抵消了苹果和亚马逊令人失望的最新财报。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Friday as hopes of a de-escalation in a punishing U.S.-China trade war offset disappointing earnings updates from Apple and Amazon.】

item.title: 埃克森公司利润超出华尔街预期，受圭亚那和二叠纪生产提振
item.description: 埃克森美孚周五公布的第一季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，原因是圭亚那和二叠纪盆地的石油和天然气产量增加，帮助提高了收益。【原文：Exxon Mobil on Friday beat Wall Street's estimate for first-quarter profit as higher oil and gas production from Guyana and the Permian basin helped boost earnings.】

item.title: 炼油业务较上一季度有所恢复，雪佛龙利润符合华尔街预期
item.description: 雪佛龙（Chevron）周五公布的第一季度财报符合华尔街预期，该公司的炼油业务已从去年年底的亏损扭亏为盈。【原文：Chevron on Friday reported first-quarter earnings that met Wall Street estimates, as the company saw a turnaround in its refining business from a loss late last year.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，欧洲将把俄罗斯被冻结的数十亿美元现金交给西方投资者
item.description: 路透社和熟悉内情的人士看到的文件显示，在莫斯科攫取俄罗斯投资者的现金后，欧洲清算公司计划扣押并重新分配比利时清算公司冻结的约 30 亿欧元（约合 34 亿美元）俄罗斯资金。【原文：Euroclear plans to seize and redistribute about 3 billion euros ($3.4 billion) of Russia's funds that are frozen at the Belgian clearing firm after Moscow grabbed investor cash in Russia, according to documents seen by Reuters and people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 杜邦利润超预期，电子业务部门从人工智能芯片热潮中获益
item.description: 周五，杜邦公司第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其电子行业部门销售额的增长。【原文：DuPont beat Wall Street expectations for first-quarter profit on Friday, helped by higher sales in its unit that caters to the electronics industry, and it warned of a hit to full-year earnings from tariffs.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻：美联储前景受关注，美股反弹势头增强
item.description: 下周的美联储会议将考验美国股市的大幅反弹，投资者希望央行准备在未来几个月继续降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve meeting in the coming week is set to test the U.S. stock market's sharp rebound, with investors hoping the central bank is poised to resume lowering interest rates in the months ahead.】

item.title: TikTok 因数据保护问题被欧盟监管机构罚款 5.3 亿欧元
item.description: 周五，TikTok 被其主要欧盟隐私监管机构处以 5.3 亿欧元（6 亿美元）的罚款，原因是其保护用户信息的方式令人担忧。【原文：TikTok was fined 530 million euros ($600 million) by its lead EU privacy regulator on Friday over concerns on how it protects user information and was ordered to suspend data transfers to China if its processing is not brought into compliance within six months.】

item.title: 谷歌将在反垄断案中寻求避免广告技术剥离
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周五将敦促法官避免拆分其广告技术业务，以结束对互联网广告销售重要工具的控制。【原文：Alphabet's Google on Friday will urge a judge to avoid breaking up its advertising technology business as part of an effort to end its control of tools vital to selling ads on the internet.】

item.title: DHL 首席执行官称竞争对手关于其违反反垄断规则的说法毫无根据
item.description: 德国邮政服务集团 DHL 首席执行官周五表示，规模较小的竞争对手 Deutsche Versand Services GmbH 对其反竞争行为的指控毫无根据。【原文：The CEO of German postal services group DHL said on Friday that accusations of anti-competitive conduct brought by smaller rival Deutsche Versand Services GmbH were without any merit.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商 Polestar 因后视影像问题召回 27816 辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周五表示，电动汽车制造商Polestar因后视摄像头问题在美国召回27816辆汽车。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Polestar is recalling 27,816 cars in the United States over an issue with the rearview camera, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Friday.】

item.title: 汇丰称贸易动荡对全球经济增长构成严重风险
item.description: 汇丰银行（HSBC）主席马克-塔克（Mark Tucker）周五表示，全球贸易关系的变化加剧了经济的不确定性，给经济增长带来了严重的潜在风险，阻碍了国际银行有效解读中期前景的努力。【原文：Shifting global trade relations have upped economic uncertainty with serious potential risks to growth, hampering attempts by international banks to read the medium term outlook effectively, HSBC Chairman Mark Tucker said on Friday.】

item.title: 更正： 联合国粮农组织称四月份世界粮食价格上涨
item.description: 联合国粮食及农业组织周五表示，受谷物、肉类和乳制品价格上涨的推动，4月份全球食品商品价格上涨。【原文：Global food commodity prices increased in April, driven by higher prices for cereals, meat and dairy products, the United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organization said on Friday.】

item.title: 苹果股价下跌，关税成本将增加更多痛苦
item.description: 苹果公司股价周五在盘前交易中下跌近 3%，原因是这家 iPhone 制造商缩减了股票回购计划，而且首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）警告说，在中美贸易战肆虐的背景下，本季度与关税相关的成本将增加约 9 亿美元。【原文：Apple shares fell nearly 3% in premarket trade on Friday after the iPhone maker trimmed its share buyback program and CEO Tim Cook warned of additional tariff-related costs of about $900 million this quarter amid a raging Sino-U.S. trade war.】

item.title: 法国 Lactalis 公司称未就可能的恒天然单位收购签署协议
item.description: 全球最大的乳制品集团 Lactalis 周五表示，它对国际投资感兴趣，但尚未签署收购新西兰乳制品巨头恒天然集团（Fonterra）部分股份的协议。【原文：Lactalis, the world's largest dairy group, is interested in international investments but has not signed an agreement to buy parts of New Zealand-based dairy giant Fonterra, it said on Friday following reports it was considering an offer.】

item.title: 欧元区 4 月份通胀率保持稳定，服务价格飙升
item.description: 欧元区 4 月份的通胀率保持稳定，略高于欧洲央行 2% 的目标，但潜在的价格压力比预计的要大，这可能会让欧洲央行的一些决策者感到紧张，即使贸易战可能成为更多降息的理由。【原文：Euro zone inflation held steady a touch above the ECB's 2% target in April but underlying price pressures picked up more than projected, likely making some ECB policymakers nervous, even if a trade war may justify more interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 在美国关税不确定性的背景下，日本贸易公司以健康回报吸引投资者
item.description: 从三菱商事到住友商事等日本商社都承诺，在美国关税不确定性的背景下，今年的股东回报将保持健康，同时对利润预测持谨慎态度，力图让包括沃伦-巴菲特在内的投资者感到满意。【原文：Japanese trading houses from Mitsubishi to Sumitomo Corp promised healthy shareholder returns this year amid cautious profit forecasts, trying to keep investors, including Warren Buffett, happy amid U.S. tariff uncertainty.】

item.title: 特斯拉 4 月份在欧洲主要市场的销量大幅下滑
item.description: 随着欧洲人购买更多的中国汽车以及一些人对马斯克政治观点的抗议，特斯拉 4 月份在一些欧洲市场的销量大幅下降，埃隆-马斯克的电动汽车品牌自今年年初以来的趋势有所加快。【原文：Tesla sales in some European markets fell sharply in April, in an acceleration of a trend seen since the beginning of the year for Elon Musk's EV brand, as Europeans buy more Chinese cars and some protest against his political views.】

item.title: 日经指数》称，美国在与日本的谈判中几乎没有在关键关税问题上让步
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周五报道，在最近一次与日本同行的会谈中，美国关税谈判代表似乎不愿降低对汽车、钢铁和铝的征税--这一立场让日方感到合作可能会很困难。【原文：U.S. tariff negotiators appeared reluctant to lower levies on cars, steel and aluminium in a recent meeting with Japanese counterparts - a stance that made the Japanese side feel that cooperation could be difficult, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Friday.】

item.title: 美国银行报告显示，上周抛售美股的投资者涌向日本和欧洲
item.description: 博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）周五表示，投资者在截至周三的一周内抛售了美国股票，买入了日本和欧洲股票。【原文：Investors sold U.S. stocks in the week ending Wednesday and bought Japanese and European shares, BofA Global Research said on Friday.】

item.title: 中国 "评估 "美国提出的关税谈判提议；警告反对 "敲诈 "行为
item.description: 中国商务部周五表示，北京正在 "评估 "华盛顿提出的就美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收145%关税一事举行会谈的提议，但同时警告美国不要进行 "敲诈和胁迫"。【原文：Beijing is "evaluating" an offer from Washington to hold talks over U.S. President Donald Trump's 145% tariffs, China's Commerce Ministry said on Friday, although it warned the United States not to engage in "extortion and coercion."】

item.title: 澳大利亚对 Lactalis 未宣布的恒天然资产竞购启动非正式审查
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监督机构已开始对 Lactalis 收购新西兰恒天然集团待售业务的提议进行非正式审查，尽管这家法国乳制品巨头尚未正式宣布收购要约。【原文：Australia's competition watchdog has begun an informal review of Lactalis’ proposed offer to buy New Zealand-based Fonterra’s businesses up for sale, even though the French dairy major is yet to make a formal announcement on the offer.】
